c^ency
Cable Address:
LUCYKROLL NEW YORK
New York 19, New York
119 WEST 57th STREET
Telephone PLaza 7-4250
March 23, 1964
Mr. James A. Fellows
National Association of Education Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 36, D.C.
Dear Mr. Fellows.
Your letter of March l2th addressed to Edward Hodge of
Harcourt, Brace & World, Inc., requesting permission to
broadcast the poem, "A.E.F." by Carl Sandburg, by the
Voice of America to overseas countries via U.S.I.A. has
been forwarded to this office for reply, inasmuch as we
handle non-publishing rights to the work of Mr. Sandburg.
We are pleased to grant permission on a non-exclusive basis
for such broadcast by the Voice of America to overseas
countries and for broadcast in countries where local radio
stations may receive the taped programs through the United
States Information Agency.
Your request concerning publication of the poems must be
taken up with Mr. Sandburg's publishers, Harcourt, Brace
& World, Inc., and I am accordingly sending them a copy of
this letter, as well as a copy of your original letter to
them of March l2th. You will undoubtedly be hearing from
them directly on this matter.
Cordially yours.
LK/e
cc: Mrs. Rita Vaughan
Harcourt, Brace & World, Inc.
